author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Ex-soldier upset by no jail time recommendation for Bergdahl
text:
US ARMY / HANDOUT/EPA The Pentagon has said there’s no evidence anyone died searching for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl. A former member of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl’s platoon said Sunday he’s angered by an Army officer’s recommendation that Bergdahl face a lower-level court martial and be spared the possibility of jail time for leaving his post in Afghanistan .
Josh Korder, a former sergeant, said Bergdahl should face life in prison because he’s responsible for several deaths that occurred after Bergdahl took off in 2009.
“Was it during the search for Bergdahl that we lost men in Blackfoot company? No. But was it as a result of that search and as a result of him leaving that we lost members of Blackfoot company? Yes,” Korder said in a telephone interview.
CNN Josh Korder, a former sergeant, said Bergdahl should face life in prison because he’s responsible for several deaths that occurred after Bergdahl took off in 2009. The Pentagon has said there’s no evidence anyone died searching for Bergdahl. But his commanding officers in Afghanistan testified last month at an Article 32 hearing that a 45-day search for him put soldiers in danger.
Bergdahl was captured by the Taliban after leaving his post and held until he was exchanged last year for five Taliban commanders.
